description:
You are given a number 'n' and an array a which contains n elements. You can perform the following operation on the array:
You can choose any index i for which a[i] = a[i+1] where 0<=i<n.

Determine the minimum number of operations that is required to be done to make the product of all the numbers in the array divisible by 'k'. The number 'k' will be provided to you.

Input Format:

The first line contains two space separated integers denoting the values of 'n' and 'k'.
The second line contains 'n' space separated integers denoting the elements of array a.

Output Format:

Return the minimum number of operations required to make the product of all the elements of array divisible by 'k'.

```
Sample Input - 1

3 3
7 4 1

Sample Output - 1

2
```

Explanation: Apply the operation on index 0 two times to make the product divisible by 3.

```
Constraints:
1<=n<=10^5
2<=k<=5
```
title: Divisibility of k
